title: Behind Trump's Greenland reversal, the crucial role of NATO chief Mark Rutte
subhed: The Dutchman, who has cultivated good relations with the American president, proposed transferring sovereignty over the Pituffik military base. These concessions still need to be approved by the Danish and Greenlandic authorities.
byline: By Anne-Françoise Hivert (Malmö (Sweden) regional correspondent), Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau) and Philippe Ricard (Davos (Switzerland), special correspondent)

title: French parties briefly rally around Macron after Trump's attacks
byline: By Julie Carriat and Alexandre Pedro

title: Le Pen concedes little and insists on 'good faith' at appeal trial
US announces initial withdrawal of officers from NATO structures
subhed: The Pentagon has informed its European allies of the upcoming withdrawal of about 200 American personnel from specific structures within NATO.

title: How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data
subhed: Companies are offering law enforcement agencies the ability to track smartphone users through advertising data gathered on their devices. Le Monde attended confidential presentations of these new surveillance tools to learn more.

title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
subhed: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.

title: 'Europeans were right to stand firm' against Trump, says France's top business representative
subhed: Patrick Martin, the president of France's largest business association, calls on EU countries to 'assert their strength' against the US in an interview with Le Monde.

'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhed: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Claude Le Roy: 'The Senegalese players were overwhelmed by emotion and completely lost control'
subhed: Claude Le Roy, the former coach of Senegal, Cameroon, Ghana and Togo discusses the confusion that marred the Africa Cup of Nations final between Morocco and Senegal and the governance of world football.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhed: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.
